result.execSummary:
The defendant Dwight B Mapp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees within one year of today's date. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Huber privileges under Sec. 303.08 Wis. stats to apply for work.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees during the period of probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.

Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
As a convicted felon defendant shall never be in possession of any firearms/weaopns at any time in the future 941.29 Wisconsin Stats makes it another felon for anyone who has been convicted to ever possess a firearm, carrying with it it's own 10 year period of imprisonment or $25,000.00 fine or both.  Possess weapons as a convicted felon 973.176(1).
Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
Mental health assessment and treatment. Take all prescribed medications.

No new law violations reaching the level of probable cause finding.
No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses or drug dealings.

Cooperate with agent.
Participate in a cognitive thinking program and any other programming deemed appropriate by the department and/or agent.
Participate in and successfully complete a parenting class and a behavioral program.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens with no positive results.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dwight B Mapp

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dwight B Mapp in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  David John Behm appeared for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:  COURT ORDERED Defendant to pay costs surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees within one year of today's date.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.  

AS TO COUNT 2:    COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 120 DAYS, to run consecutive to any other sentence, in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work.

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 YEAR with the following conditions:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Pay costs, surcharges assessments, supervision DNA fees during the period of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment and treatment.
*  Random urine screens with no positive results.  No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
*  Mental Health assessment and treatment.
*  Take all prescribed medications.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms / weapons at any time in the future - 941.29 Wisconsin Stats. makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted to ever possess a firearms, carrying with it its own 10 year period of imprisonment or $25,000 fine or both. Possess Weapon as a Convicted Felon 973.176(1)
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
*  Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program, and any other programming deemed appropriate by the Department and or agent.
*  Participate in and successfully complete a Parenting Class.
*  Participate in and successfully complete a Behavorial Program.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Dwight B Mapp not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record. Defense requests an adjourned Sentencing Hearing. Case adjourned to branch 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dwight B Mapp in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Dwight B Mapp in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Case calendared for SENTENCING on 6/3/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Dwight B Mapp in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.  Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference and jury trial in Branch 15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Dwight B Mapp not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Due to the lateness of the day, case rescheduled for PLEA and SENTENCING on 5/5/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Dwight B Mapp not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 4/29/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Dwight B Mapp not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense needs to review the disc they just received. Case calendared for STATUS on 3/26/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Dwight B Mapp not in court, in custody. David Behm for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for STATUS on 3/16/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 02/19/2015 received and filed (11 Pages).

Defendant Dwight B Mapp in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Dwight B Mapp in custody.  Ron Dague for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #08CF3062 and bail/bond form in case #14CF4458 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Jeremy Klug-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI) by the Court.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dwight B Mapp in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Dwight B Mapp in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
